intro: Glockeria stricta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in various shades of green, while the flowers range from purple to white. Glockeria stricta is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
